snippet: The suit contends that the agent discriminated by taking crime on an Indian reservation less seriously than crime elsewhere.
abstract: United States Supreme Court rules that two families from Crow Indian Reservation in Montana can proceed with lawsuit accusing Federal Bureau of Investigation agent Matthew Oravec of failing to properly investigate crimes against American Indians; decision puts law enforcement agents on notice that they may be held personally liable if they discriminate against Indians in investigating crimes against them.
lead_paragraph: The suit contends that the agent discriminated by taking crime on an Indian reservation less seriously than crime elsewhere.

headline.seo: Crow Indians’ Suit Against Federal Agent Allowed
headline.main: Crow Indians’ Lawsuit Against F.B.I. Agent to Proceed
headline.print_headline: Crow Indians’ Lawsuit Against F.B.I. Agent to Proceed
